definition: sudden unannounced investigation/on-the-spot inspection/to search without notification
to dash/to move forward quickly/to bulge/to protrude/to break through/to rush out/sudden/Taiwan pr. [tu2]
to hit/to strike/to break/Taiwan pr. [ji2]
to check/to examine/to inspect/to exercise restraint
surname Zha
to research/to check/to investigate/to examine/to refer to/to look up (e.g. a word in a dictionary)
see 山查[shan1 zha1]

sentences.english: Police raided businesses and confiscated hundreds of the devices.
sentences.chinese: 警察突击检查了交易活动并没收了大量仪器。

sentences.english: The police swooped on the house at dawn.
sentences.chinese: 警察拂晓对房子进行突击检查。

sentences.english: A police raid on a shop in L ond on found 138 shawls.
sentences.chinese: 警察突击检查伦敦的一所商店，发现了138件披肩。

sentences.english: The raid doesn't necessarily mean the Internet-search giant will face charges.
sentences.chinese: 突击检查不一定意味着谷歌将会遭到起诉。

sentences.english: It recently conducted surprise inspections in Liaoyuan, a city in Jilin Province, the newspaper reported.
sentences.chinese: 最近对吉林省辽源市进行了突击检查。

sentences.english: The authorities launch occasional raids on restaurants and dealers.
sentences.chinese: 政府不时地会对饭店和商贩发动突击检查。

sentences.english: They at the dock ferry, but was a bright spot checks.
sentences.chinese: 他们在码头摆渡时，却遭到明台的突击检查。

definition: to make secret inquiries/to investigate in secret
open enquiries and secret search (idiom); to investigate openly and in secret/taking information from all sides
to investigate and handle (a criminal case)
open enquiries and secret search (idiom); to investigate openly and in secret/taking information from all sides
to investigate thoroughly/to carefully inspect/to verify/to ferret out (undesirable elements)
random inspection/to do a spot check
to seize/to confiscate
lair/den (of illegal activities)
inspector
unlicensed business activity
to track down and seize (a criminal suspect, contraband etc)
thorough search
to patrol
sampling/spot check/random test
to investigate strictly
to inspect/to run through a checklist/to take stock/to audit
